stories.text:
University of Colorado Boulder | Remote (United States) | Position Type: Full-Time Preferred | Software Project Manager

Founded in 2002 by Nobel Laureate Carl Wieman, the PhET Interactive Simulations project (http://phet.colorado.edu) at the University of Colorado Boulder is a world leader in the design and use of interactive math and science simulations for advancing STEM education.

We have an opening for a full-time Software Project Manager to work with our multidisciplinary team to synthesize priorities, plan and manage the project schedule, facilitate and support workflows, and communicate clearly with all stakeholders. You will have experience working with a distributed team of software engineers (but you do not need to be a software engineer or do any coding yourself).

The annual starting salary range for this position is $75,000-$95,000, adjusted accordingly for cost of living if working remotely. Salary is commensurate with education and experience.

Candidates can work remotely in the United States or relocate to Boulder. Modest relocation funds are available for this position following the University of Colorado’s relocation processes and procedures. Full job posting at https://jobs.colorado.edu/jobs/JobDetail/?jobId=32480
stories.title: University of Colorado Boulder – Software Project Manager
It appears the AAP quietly removed “Face Time and Emotional Health” info

stories.text:
Debian "Bullseye" contains 1,152,960,944 lines of code. (Source: https://sources.debian.org/stats/ )

You can fit 34 lines on a page of A4, meaning 33,910,616 pages.

Using 310 micron paper & a duplex printer, a printout of the source code would be 5¼km tall.

And cost about £200,000 in toner and another £200,000 in paper.
